H0.text: Pulmonary circulation is the circuit that directs blood from the heart through the lungs and back to the heart in amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals.

H1.text: Systemic circulation is the circuit through which blood flows to the lungs and back to the heart in amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals.

H2.text: Sensory circulation is the blood flow circuit that passes through the lungs and returns to the heart in amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals.

H3.text: Metabolic circulation is the blood flow circuit in amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals that directs blood through the lungs and back to the heart.

A4.text: The pulmonary circulation is a division of the circulatory system in all vertebrates.

A5.text: The other division of the circulatory system is the systemic circulation that begins upon the oxygenated blood reaching the left atrium from the pulmonary circulation.
